sectionHeaders.discoveriesSubtitle: Our research has led to several important scientific insights

researchQuestions.title: Improving Ephemeris and Frame Tie
researchQuestions.description: How can astrometric measurements enhance the Solar System ephemeris and tighten the frame tie between VLBI and pulsar timing arrays for more accurate gravitational wave detection?

researchQuestions.title: MSP Velocity and Formation Channels
researchQuestions.description: What does the peculiar velocity distribution of millisecond pulsars tell us about their formation mechanisms, including possible differences between isolated and binary MSPs?

researchQuestions.title: Correcting the Shklovskii Effect
researchQuestions.description: How can precise astrometric distances help correct for the Shklovskii effect in binary systems and enable more accurate tests of General Relativity through pulsar orbital decay?

researchQuestions.title: Tracing the Galactic Potential with MSPs
researchQuestions.description: Can newly measured MSP binaries be used to trace the Galactic gravitational potential and better constrain the distribution of dark matter in the Milky Way?

keyFindings.title: Unprecedented Parallax Precision
keyFindings.description: Using VLBA, the project achieves sub-100 microarcsecond parallax precision, enabling accurate distance measurements to dozens of millisecond pulsars—critical for mapping the Galaxy and improving gravitational wave detection models.

keyFindings.title: Refinement of Galactic Electron Density Models
keyFindings.description: Our measurements provide key data to calibrate Galactic electron density models like NE2001 and YMW16, correcting systemic biases and improving distance estimates derived from dispersion measures.

keyFindings.title: Astrometric Contributions to Pulsar Timing Arrays
keyFindings.description: By delivering precise 3D positions and motions for pulsars, this project reduces errors in pulsar timing arrays, enhancing their sensitivity to gravitational waves from supermassive black hole binaries.

pulsarJourney.subtitle: From telescope to theory, explore how pulsar astrometry unfolds through the VLBA project

steps.title: Pulsar Discovery
steps.description: Our journey begins with the detection of radio pulses from distant neutron stars.

steps.title: Timing and Analysis
steps.description: Pulsar timing models help refine celestial coordinates and enable scheduling of precise VLBI observations.

steps.title: Astrometric Observation
steps.description: Using VLBA, we track the pulsar’s position across epochs to extract parallax and proper motion.

steps.title: Distance and Impact
steps.description: With accurate distances, we advance studies in gravitational waves, pulsar velocities, and Galactic structure.

steps.title: Scientific Discovery
steps.description: Results feed into broader astrophysical insights, including dark matter constraints and gravitational wave science.
